First, let's get to the initial topic of this thread.

As posted previousely by several other fellow developers, you can always 
have two source paths, one for the source and one for the test cases. 
 In this way, JavaDoc will not have any problems any more.  This setup 
also has some good side-effects: In this way, you can write a class that 
can scan the test source path and create a TestSuite that contains all 
the test cases simply by matching the file names; it will always be easy 
to deliver binary without the testcases in it, if that is desired.

Second, I do find it a lot more pleasant to clicking through the html 
files rather than open up the source files to understand certain things. 
 I do agree that making the code and document in sync. is a hassle, though.

Shane
